tutorials.title: Getting Started
tutorials.description: In this brief tutorial you will learn how to add layers, add data to layers, visualize that data on a map, and then share the results.

tutorials.title: Customizing Your Maps
tutorials.description: In this tutorial, you will learn how to customize how your map looks.

body.title: Why are you here?
text: This tool will help you change the world!
If it doesn't there, then we're sorry.

bodyContent.content: Our latest, most powerful tool to find, visualize, analyze, and export community data.

Hundreds of easy-to-find demographic, education, health, and economic indicators from local, state, and national sources, all in one place, as well as the ability to upload and visualize your own data!
Explore neighborhoods, census tracts, zip codes, cities, counties, and more geographies across the state of Georgia.
Data sources currently accessible via this tool are:

content: US Census Bureau's American Community Survey (ACS), 5-year estimates (2017 to 2019)
US Census Bureau's Longitudinal Employer-Household Dynamics (LEHD) Origin-Destination Data (2010, 2017, 2018, & 2019)
GA Department of Public Health (DPH) Maternal and Child Health Statistics (2004 to 2019)
GA Department of Educution (DOE) Student- and School-level Statistics (2018-19 School Year)
Georgia's Cross-Agency Child Data System (CACDS) Data (2017-2020)

sourceManifest.ACS: US Census Bureau's American Community Survey (ACS), 5-year estimates
sourceManifest.ACS, TIGER: US Census Bureau's American Community Survey (ACS) & TIGER/Line
sourceManifest.Decennial/ACS: US Census Bureau's American Community Survey (ACS), 5-year estimates & Decennial Census
sourceManifest.LEHD Origin-Destination Data: U.S. Census Bureau's Longitudinal Employer-Household Dynamics (LEHD) Origin-Destination Data
sourceManifest.Georgia Department of Public Health (DPH: Georgia Department of Public Health (GA DPH) OASIS
sourceManifest.LEHD, Origin-Destination Data: U.S. Census Bureau's Longitudinal Employer-Household Dynamics (LEHD) Origin-Destination Data
sourceManifest.Georgia Department of Public Health, OHI: Georgia Department of Public Health (GA DPH), OASIS
sourceManifest.DPH OASIS: Georgia Department of Public Health (GA DPH) OASIS
sourceManifest.ACS, Georgia Department of Public Health: US Census Bureau's American Community Survey (ACS), 5-year estimates & Georgia Department of Public Health (GA DPH), OASIS
sourceManifest.CACDS, Decennial Census: Georgia's Cross-Agency Child Data System (CACDS) & US Census Bureau's Decennial Census

header.main: Welcome to the GEEARS Readiness Radar Tool

body.title: The GEEARS Readiness Radar provides education leaders and advocates with curated data relevant to early childhood and school readiness in Georgia.
text: Ideal for community-level planning, users can quickly assess child well-being and early learning resources. Selected indicators are available for small area (census tracts) and county geographies, as well as point-level schools and early education program sites.

bodyContent.content: The GEEARS Readiness Radar provides education leaders and advocates with curated data relevant to early childhood and school readiness in Georgia.

Ideal for community-level planning, users can quickly assess child well-being and early learning resources. Selected indicators are available for small area (census tracts) and county geographies, as well as point-level schools and early education program sites.
Many community indicators can be accessed in the tool, including:

content: GEEARS Early Childhood Index (census tract layer)
Milestone performance data (census tract and county layers)
Public health data (census and county layers)
Updating quality rated and other early education program locations (asset layer)

bodyContent.content: Contact GEEARS Research Director, Hanah Goldberg (hgoldberg@geears.org) with questions.
